text: Paul Ambros (23 June 1933 – 26 June 2015) was a German ice hockey player. He was part of the United Team of Germany, which represented the country at the 1956, 1960 and 1964 Winter Olympics.Paul Ambros: Der „Tiger vom Hopfensee“ ist tot Born in Füssen, Germany, Ambros played for EV Füssen from 1949 until 1965, scoring more than 60 goals in 200 games and helping his team win the Spengler Cup in 1965. He then played for Augsburger EV from 1965 until 1973. He was often referred as "Der Tiger vom Hopfensee (The Tiger from Hopfensee)". Ambros is a member of the German Ice Hockey Hall of Fame. Ambros died on 26 June 2015 at the age of 82, following a lengthy undisclosed illness. He is survived by his wife, Inge.Paul Ambros passes away ==References== ==External links== * Category:1933 births Category:2015 deaths Category:German ice hockey defencemen Category:Ice hockey players at the 1956 Winter Olympics Category:Ice hockey players at the 1960 Winter Olympics Category:Ice hockey players at the 1964 Winter Olympics Category:Olympic ice hockey players of Germany Category:People from Füssen Category:Sportspeople from Bavaria Category:Olympic ice hockey players of the United Team of Germany
title: Paul Ambros
